title: Vega raises $120M Series B to rethink how enterprises detect cyber threats
summary: Vega Security raised $120 million, bringing its valuation to $700 million, in a round led by Accel. The company aims to rethink how enterprises detect cybersecurity threats.

title: Hauler Hero collects $16M for its AI waste management software
summary: Hauler Hero has seen its customer base, revenue, and head count double since the company raised its seed round in 2024.

title: India orders social media platforms to take down deepfakes faster
summary: India’s new rules take effect February 20, tightening deepfake oversight and shrinking takedown windows to as little as two hours.

title: Former GitHub CEO raises record $60M dev tool seed round at $300M valuation
summary: Thomas Dohmke's new startup offers an AI system to allow developers to better manage all the code AI agents produce.

title: AI video startup Runway raises $315M at $5.3B valuation, eyes more capable world models
summary: Startup Runway has raised a $315 million round at a $5.3 billion valuation, funds it will use to expand beyond AI video generation and into world models.

title: The first signs of burnout are coming from the people who embrace AI the most
summary: Because employees could do more, work began bleeding into lunch breaks and late evenings. The employees' to-do lists expanded to fill every hour that AI freed up, and then kept going.

title: Databricks CEO says SaaS isn’t dead, but AI will soon make it irrelevant
summary: AI isn't going to replace major SaaS apps with vibe-coded versions, Databricks CEO Ali Ghodsi believes. But it could give rise to competitors.

title: Anthropic’s India expansion collides with a local company that already had the name
summary: India's Anthropic Software has taken the U.S. AI giant to court over a name dispute.

title: A “QuitGPT” campaign is urging people to cancel their ChatGPT subscriptions
summary: In September, Alfred Stephen, a freelance software developer in Singapore, purchased a ChatGPT Plus subscription, which costs $20 a month and offers more access to advanced models, to speed up his work. title: An experimental surgery is helping cancer survivors give birth
summary: This week I want to tell you about an experimental surgical procedure that’s helping people have babies. Specifically, it’s helping people who have had treatment for bowel or rectal cancer. Radiation and chemo can have pretty damaging side effects that mess up the uterus and ovaries. Surgeons are pioneering a potential solution: simply stitch those…

title: Autodesk is suing Google over the name of its Flow AI videomaker
summary: Autodesk, a company known for its suite of 3D design software, is suing Google over claims that it infringed on its "Flow" trademark, as reported earlier by Reuters. The lawsuit, filed in a California court last week, alleges that the name of Google's AI video generator, Flow, will likely confuse customers with Autodesk's own AI-enabled […]

title: Could the Trump Phone be a good phone?
summary: We have long had our doubts about the Trump Phone. Since its very first debut, the device - technically called the Trump Mobile T1 Phone 8002 - has seemed utterly impossible to execute as advertised. The Trump Mobile team has also spent the last eight months rapidly moving the goalposts, changing specs and making increasingly […]

title: Vibe coding Nothing’s apps is fun, until you try to make them useful
summary: After a week vibe coding apps using Nothing's Essential Apps Builder, I'm conflicted. I buy into the smartphone maker's vision for software that adapts to you, not the other way around, but right now it doesn't deliver. It's hard to see how this goes from cool novelty to a reliable tool without serious refinement, and […]

title: ChatGPT’s cheapest options now show you ads
summary: ChatGPT users may soon start seeing ads in their chats, as OpenAI announced on Monday that it's officially beginning to test ads on its AI platform. They'll appear as labeled "sponsored" links at the bottom of ChatGPT answers, but OpenAI says the ads "do not influence the answers ChatGPT gives you." Currently, ads will only […]

title: AI-generated ads dropped the ball at this year’s Super Bowl
summary: It feels like everyone who produced ad spots for this year's Super Bowl with generative AI failed in terms of making gen AI seem useful or like something worth getting excited about. Though we've seen plenty of AI-generated commercials before (at previous Super Bowls, no less), this year's event was oversaturated with them. That's in […]

title: OpenAI will reportedly start testing ads in ChatGPT today
summary: OpenAI plans to start testing ads in ChatGPT today, according to a report from CNBC. The "clearly labeled" ads will appear in a separate area beneath your chat, OpenAI announced last month. A source close to the situation tells CNBC that OpenAI "expects ads to make up less than half of its revenue long term." […]

title: OpenAI’s supposedly ‘leaked’ Super Bowl ad with ear buds and a shiny orb was a hoax
summary: As if OpenAI didn't have enough drama around the Super Bowl and advertising, as the game wound down, word spread of a "leaked" ad that actually wasn't leaked at all; it was just a fake. Screenshots of a now-deleted Reddit thread told the tale of a frustrated employee who, while posting about how upset they […]

title: OpenAI Abandons ‘io’ Branding for Its AI Hardware
summary: A court filing in a trademark lawsuit reveals OpenAI won't use the name “io” for its AI hardware device, which isn't expected to ship until 2027.

title: No Company Has Admitted to Replacing Workers With AI in New York
summary: New York state has required companies to disclose if “technological innovation or automation” was the cause of job loss for nearly a year. So far, none has.

title: AI Is Here to Replace Nuclear Treaties. Scared Yet?
summary: The last major nuclear arms treaty between the US and Russia just expired. Some experts believe a combination of satellite surveillance, AI, and human reviewers can take its place. Others, not so much.

title: The Technologies Changing How You’ll Watch the 2026 Winter Olympic Games
summary: From drones with “first-person” visualization to real-time 360-degree replays and Olympics GPT, get ready to immerse yourself in the Winter Games in Milan and Cortina.

summary: Plus: Apple’s Lockdown mode keeps the FBI out of a reporter’s phone, Elon Musk’s Starlink cuts off Russian forces, and more.

title: New York Is the Latest State to Consider a Data Center Pause
summary: Red and blue states alike have introduced legislation in recent weeks that would halt data center development, citing concerns from climate to high energy prices.

title: The Only Thing Standing Between Humanity and AI Apocalypse Is … Claude?
summary: As AI systems grow more powerful, Anthropic’s resident philosopher says the startup is betting Claude itself can learn the wisdom needed to avoid disaster.

title: Loyalty Is Dead in Silicon Valley
summary: Founders used to be wedded to their companies. Now, anyone can be lured away for the right price.
